data.name: AutodetectLanguage
data.comment: The user can configure the application language and choose between English, French, etc. and Autodetect

data.name: KeyLMenu
data.comment: The name of the key on the keyboard

data.name: KeyRMenu
data.comment: The name of the key on the keyboard

data.name: KeyLControl
data.comment: The name of the key on the keyboard

data.name: KeyRControl
data.comment: The name of the key on the keyboard

data.name: KeyLWin
data.comment: The name of the key on the keyboard

data.name: KeyRWin
data.comment: The name of the key on the keyboard

data.name: KeyCapital
data.comment: The name of the key on the keyboard

data.name: KeyNumLock
data.comment: The name of the key on the keyboard

data.name: KeyPause
data.comment: The name of the key on the keyboard

data.name: KeyApps
data.comment: Also known as Application key

data.name: KeyEscape
data.comment: The name of the key on the keyboard

data.name: KeyConvert
data.comment: The name of the 変換 key on a Japanese keyboard

data.name: KeyNonConvert
data.comment: The name of the 無変換 key on a Japanese keyboard

data.name: KeyScroll
data.comment: The name of the key on the keyboard

data.name: KeySpace
data.comment: The name of the key on the keyboard

data.name: KeyReturn
data.comment: The name of the key on the keyboard

data.name: Composing
data.comment: The "Composing" section in the settings window

data.name: UseXorgRules
data.value: Use sequences from the Xorg project

data.name: UseXorgRulesToolTip
data.value: Use the 3,000 compose sequences from the Xorg project (http://www.x.org/). These are the sequences most commonly found on a standard Linux system.

data.name: UseXComposeRules
data.value: Use sequences from the XCompose project

data.name: UseXComposeRulesToolTip
data.value: Use the 1,000 compose sequences from the XCompose opensource project (https://github.com/kragen/xcompose). These sequences may sometimes conflict with the Xorg ones.

data.name: UseEmojiRulesToolTip
data.value: Use the compose sequences for Emoji provided by the WinCompose author and contributors.

data.name: DebugWindow
data.comment: Menu entry to show the debug window

data.name: Disable
data.comment: Menu entry to disable WinCompose

data.name: DonationPage
data.comment: A button to visit the donation page (http://wincompose.info/donate/)

data.name: VisitWebsite
data.comment: A button to visit the website

data.name: UnicodeCharacters
data.comment: Name of the category (Unicode characters, Emoji, User macros, Favorites)

data.name: SwapOnInvalid
data.value: Try to swap the two keys

data.name: SwapOnInvalidToolTip
data.value: Try to swap the keys of a two-key sequence. For instance, if Compose E A is not a valid sequence, try Compose A E instead.

data.name: ComposeKeyToolTip
data.value: Select the key that should act as the Compose key.

data.name: ResetTimeout
data.comment: The compose key deactivates itself after a certain configurable delay

data.name: UnicodeInputToolTip
data.value: Enable Unicode input for all characters, even those with no compose sequence defined. For instance, the following sequence will output character U+1A3F: Compose U 1 A 3 F Enter

data.name: InvalidSequences
data.comment: This is the name of a category of settings about what happens when invalid sequences are typed

data.name: CaseInsensitive
data.value: Fall back to case insensitive matches

data.name: CaseInsensitiveToolTip
data.value: If the entered sequence does not exist, but there is one that only differs by case, automatically correct it.

data.name: DiscardOnInvalidToolTip
data.value: If the entered sequence does not exist, discard all the characters that were typed. The default behaviour is to output the characters as if the compose key had not been used.

data.name: BeepOnInvalidToolTip
data.value: If the entered sequence does not exist, emit a system sound.

data.name: LanguageToolTip
data.value: Select the language that WinCompose uses for the interface. By default the operating system language is used.

data.name: Close
data.comment: Close the settings window

data.name: CopyToClipboard
data.comment: Copy character or symbol to the clipboard

data.name: Emoji
data.comment: Name of the category (Unicode characters, Emoji, User macros, Favorites)

data.name: Apply
data.comment: Apply changes from the settings window

data.name: KeepOriginalKey
data.comment: Should this say “retain” instead of “maintain”?

data.name: KeepOriginalKeyToolTip
data.value: This tells WinCompose to make a best effort to retain the original key’s behaviour. For instance, the Alt-Tab shortcut will still work even if Alt is used as the compose key.

data.name: InsertZwsp
data.value: Insert zero-width spaces in Office apps

data.name: InsertZwspToolTip
data.value: Microsoft Office applications sometimes change the document font on the fly when entering certain Unicode characters. This feature inserts an invisible character after the Unicode character to work around the bug.

data.name: EmulateCapsLock
data.value: Emulate Caps Lock using both Shift keys

data.name: EmulateCapsLockToolTip
data.value: If Caps Lock is used as the compose key, the original behaviour of the key becomes unavailable. This feature allows to turn Caps Lock on by pressing both Shift keys simultaneously.

data.name: ShiftDisablesCapsLockToolTip
data.value: If Caps Lock is used as the compose key, the original behaviour of the key becomes unavailable. This feature allows to turn Caps Lock off by pressing the Shift key.

data.name: CapsLockCapitalizesToolTip
data.value: When Caps Lock is on, typing an accented letter such as “é” will always output the corresponding capitalized letter, in this case “É”.

data.name: Categories
data.comment: Header for the list of Unicode character categories

data.name: Options
data.comment: The title of the Options window

data.name: ShowOptions
data.comment: Microsoft recommends using this instead of Settings or Preferences (https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn742392.aspx)

data.name: TrayToolTip
data.comment: {0}: compose key name, {1}: number of sequences, {2}: program version number

data.name: General
data.comment: The “general” tab of the options window

data.name: WindowTitle
data.comment: The title of the Sequences window

data.name: UserMacros
data.comment: Name of the category (Unicode characters, Emoji, User macros, Favorites)

data.name: KeyInsert
data.comment: The name of the "Insert" key on the keyboard

data.name: TestTyping
data.comment: The "Test Typing" section in the settings window

data.name: Tweaks
data.comment: The "Tweaks" section in the settings window

data.name: DelaySeconds
data.comment: Format string to display the current reset delay

data.name: About
data.comment: About box menu entry

data.name: Download
data.comment: Download new version menu entry. {0}: version number

data.name: AboutBoxTitle
data.comment: Window title of the About box

data.name: Programming
data.comment: The section where we list all programmers.

data.name: Translators
data.comment: The section where we list all translators. If you’re reading this, you’re probably a translator, so thank you! You rock!

data.name: Authors
data.comment: The tab item to see all the program authors.

data.name: License
data.comment: US: License, UK: Licence

data.name: NeedRestart
data.value: WinCompose needs to be restarted for some changes to take effect.
data.comment: Warning message when the user changes the language in the settings window

data.name: ReportBug
data.comment: A button to report bugs (opens web browser)

data.name: Help
data.comment: The context menu for about, help, and software updates

data.name: UpdatesToolTip
data.comment: Message displayed in the notification area tooltip.

data.name: UserDefinedSequencesEdit
data.comment: A button to open the file containing the user-defined sequences.

data.name: UserDefinedSequencesReload
data.comment: A button to reload the user-defined sequences.

data.name: AllowInjectedToolTip
data.value: Do not ignore keys sent by other software like AutoHotkey or Synergy

data.name: KeyPrint
data.comment: The name of the “Print Screen” key on the keyboard

data.name: KeyDisabled
data.comment: String to show instead of the key name when no compose key is configured

data.name: CheckUpdatesToolTip
data.value: If enabled, WinCompose will connect to the Internet at regular intervals to check for new versions. Updates are not installed automatically.

data.name: KeepIconVisible
data.value: Try to keep notification area icon always visible

data.name: KeepIconVisibleToolTip
data.value: By default, Windows will remove the icon from the notification area after a short while. This option attempts to keep it always visible.

data.name: ChangeComposeKey
data.comment: The user can click on this button to change the current compose key.

data.name: CaptureComposeKey
data.value: Please press a key to use as your compose key.

data.name: AddToFavorites
data.comment: Add sequence to the list of favorites.

data.name: DisableIconToolTip
data.value: If enabled, WinCompose will no longer display an icon in the notification area. The only way to open the WinCompose interface will then be through the “WinCompose Settings” and “WinCompose Sequences” entries in the startup menu.

data.name: KeyHome
data.comment: The name of the “Home” key on the keyboard

data.name: KeyEnd
data.comment: The name of the “End” key on the keyboard

data.name: KeyTab
data.comment: The name of the “Tab” key on the keyboard

data.name: NoTimeout
data.comment: Text to show instead of a value in seconds when the reset timeout feature is disabled

data.name: Advanced
data.comment: The “Advanced” section in the settings.

data.name: IgnoreRegex
data.comment: “regex” is shorthand for “regular expression”.

data.name: IgnoreRegexToolTip
data.value: WinCompose will be completely disabled when the current window class or window name matches this regular expression.

data.name: AlwaysCompose
data.value: Alternate compose key is always Compose

data.name: AlwaysComposeToolTip
data.value: If enabled, all compose keys will be treated as Compose in a sequence. By default, only the first pressed key will act as Compose, and alternate compose keys will keep their original role.

data.name: SpecialThanks
data.comment: The section for random contributors who aren’t programmers or translators. Might be empty.

data.name: RemoveFromFavorites
data.comment: Remove sequence from the list of favorites.

data.name: Favorites
data.comment: Name of the category (Unicode characters, Emoji, User macros, Favorites)
